Nextcloud strives to make migration of c: Nextcloud strives to make migration of customers from ownCloud™ as seamless as possible. Due to the large technical overlap, the migration of the application is easy. Business processes are equally easily updated.
Moving from ownCloud\u2122 to Nextcloud: Moving from ownCloud™ to Nextcloud follows the same process as a upgrade within either product. You can essentially follow our usual upgrade documentation.
Enable Maintenance Mode with the command: Enable Maintenance Mode with the command line tool
delete the ownCloud code and extract the: delete the ownCloud code and extract the Nextcloud code
start the upgrade process with the comma: start the upgrade process with the command line tool
Find more details in <a href=\"<?php ech: Find more details in our documentation.
Note that, as ownCloud does not support: Note that, as ownCloud does not support skipping releases, upgrades have to go through all releases between the existing ownCloud release and the desired Nextcloud release. We will support upgrades from ownCloud 8.2 and onwards. If you are on a older release, contact our support team or ask sales for an offer.
Nextcloud is licensed exclusively under: Nextcloud is licensed exclusively under the AGPL or less restrictive open source licenses, removing any risk of mixing incompatible licenses or other legal issues. If you have not made any changes to the code of ownCloud Server™ and did not develop custom ownCloud applications, you will not need to do anything to be in compliance with the open source licenses of Nextcloud. Note that theme changes or branding are unaffected by AGPL licensing. Find more information in our FAQ. Our sales team will be happy to answer any questions you have.
Nextcloud will honor any any valid contr: Nextcloud will honor any any valid contract with ownCloud which has started before the 2nd of June for free if a new agreement is signed for a period of at least 12 months.
